meanings.definition: The customary or established practices of a particular group or community.
meanings.sent1: In our town, the praxes include a yearly parade and a summer festival.
meanings.sent2: Learning the praxes of a new culture can be both challenging and rewarding.
meanings.sent3: At the silly hat party, wearing socks on your hands was considered part of the praxes.
meanings.sent4: The praxes of good manners are like the glue that holds society together.
meanings.sent5: Grandma's stories about the praxes of her youth always fascinated me.

meanings.definition: The practical application or exercise of a theory or skill.
meanings.sent1: Before the exam, students were given time to practice the praxes of solving equations.
meanings.sent2: Doctors must demonstrate their praxes in diagnosing illnesses before they can practice independently.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle while riding a unicycle is definitely not part of the praxes for most people.
meanings.sent4: In the kitchen, the chef's praxes were like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The coach emphasized the importance of perfecting the praxes of shooting free throws.
